U: S. Sen. John Cornyn cited information from the Border Patrol about people from countries other than Mexico who have been detained near the southwestern border for illegally entering the United States.
The U: S. Border Patrol publishes data on apprehensions near the southwestern border, which showed that nearly all apprehensions are of Mexican nationals.
Cornyn: s office provided a chart that listed a country-by-country breakdown of arrests "by citizenship" for illegal entry on the southwestern border during the specified time period.
